intro: Gochnatia arequipensis, commonly known as the Arequipa gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Peru. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and clustered. Gochnatia arequipensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
